episodeTitle: Many Problems Lie Ahead! A Trap Awaiting in the New World!
description: As the Straw Hats prepare to leave Fish-Man Island, Minister of the Right discovers the Tamate Box has been given to Big Mom's subordinates. Caribou attempts to reclaim his stolen treasure but is defeated by Pekoms' Haki. Meanwhile, Jinbe discusses leaving Big Mom's protection to join the Straw Hats, and Smoker intercepts pirates entering the New World.

events.title: Pike and Bomba Debut
events.description: Pike and Bomba, two G-5 Marines, make their first appearance alongside Vice Admiral Smoker as they patrol the entrance to the New World.
events.significance: Introduces two recurring G-5 Marine characters who will appear throughout the Punk Hazard arc.

events.title: Minister of the Right Reveals Tamate Box Contains Bomb
events.description: The Minister of the Right panics upon learning that the Tamate Box has been given to Big Mom's subordinates, revealing that he rigged the box with explosives after Hody stole the Energy Steroids from it 10 years ago.
events.significance: This setup becomes crucial hundreds of episodes later when the bomb saves the Straw Hats during the Whole Cake Island arc by toppling Big Mom's castle.

quotes.text: The Tamate Box... it has a bomb inside that will explode when opened!
quotes.speaker: Minister of the Right
quotes.context: Revealing the danger of the treasure given to Big Mom

events.title: Caribou Attacks Pekoms for His Treasure
events.description: Caribou discovers that Pekoms and Baron Tamago have his stolen treasure and attacks them with a gatling gun from his Numa Numa no Mi swamp body.
events.significance: Demonstrates the difference in power between a rookie pirate and an Emperor's crew member.

events.title: Pekoms Reveals His Turtle Devil Fruit Powers
events.description: Pekoms transforms into a turtle using the Kame Kame no Mi, using his shell's diamond-hard defense to block Caribou's gatling gun attack without taking any damage.
events.significance: First demonstration of Pekoms' Devil Fruit ability and the first Zoan-type Devil Fruit revealed in the post-timeskip era.

quotes.text: My shell is hard as diamond!
quotes.speaker: Pekoms

events.title: Pekoms Defeats Caribou with Haki-Enhanced Punch
events.description: Pekoms uses Armament Haki to penetrate Caribou's Logia defenses, knocking him out with a single punch while simultaneously breaking his scythe.
events.significance: Demonstrates the New World standard where Haki users can easily defeat Logia users who rely solely on their intangibility. Shows the power gap between Paradise and New World pirates.

quotes.text: The downfall of a Logia is its own pride of invincibility.
quotes.speaker: Pekoms
quotes.context: After defeating Caribou who relied too heavily on his Logia powers

events.title: Jinbe Decides to Leave Big Mom's Protection
events.description: Jinbe discusses with Neptune his intention to sever ties with Big Mom to join the Straw Hat Pirates, despite concerns about Big Mom's potential retaliation against Fish-Man Island.
events.significance: Sets up Jinbe's eventual formal joining of the Straw Hat crew and creates tension with Big Mom that will culminate in the Whole Cake Island arc.

quotes.text: I'm thinking of cutting ties with Big Mom. Luffy invited me to join the Straw Hats.
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Confiding in Neptune about his decision

events.title: Neptune Requests Straw Hat Flag for Protection
events.description: Neptune proposes borrowing the Straw Hat Pirates' flag to protect Fish-Man Island after they lose Big Mom's protection, believing the island can now defend itself with the former soldiers from the Fish-Man District.
events.significance: Marks Fish-Man Island's shift from Big Mom's territory to being under the Straw Hats' protection, showcasing Luffy's growing influence as a major pirate.

quotes.text: You take on too much responsibility, Jinbe. We should be able to defend ourselves. I will seek to borrow the Straw Hats' flag for protection.
quotes.speaker: Neptune
quotes.context: Reassuring Jinbe about Fish-Man Island's future

events.title: Concern Over Tamate Box Explosion as Declaration of War
events.description: Neptune and the Minister of the Right express horror that when Big Mom opens the Tamate Box, the explosion will appear to be a deliberate act of war from Luffy and the Straw Hats.
events.significance: Foreshadows the events of the Whole Cake Island arc where the bomb's explosion during the tea party becomes a pivotal moment, though it ultimately helps the Straw Hats rather than hurts them.

quotes.text: When Big Mom opens that box and it explodes, it will look like a declaration of war from Luffy!
quotes.speaker: Neptune
quotes.context: Fearing the consequences of the booby-trapped treasure

events.title: Smoker Arrives at New World Entrance
events.description: Vice Admiral Smoker and Captain Tashigi, now stationed at G-5 Marine Base, intercept pirates fleeing from Fish-Man Island and entering the New World.
events.significance: Establishes Smoker's new position in the New World and sets up his role in the upcoming Punk Hazard arc as the first Marine obstacle for the Straw Hats.

quotes.text: The Tamate Box... it has a bomb inside that will explode when opened!
quotes.speaker: Minister of the Right
quotes.context: Panicking about the treasure given to Big Mom

quotes.text: My shell is hard as diamond!
quotes.speaker: Pekoms
quotes.context: Demonstrating his turtle shell defense against Caribou

quotes.text: The downfall of a Logia is its own pride of invincibility.
quotes.speaker: Pekoms

quotes.text: I'm thinking of cutting ties with Big Mom. Luffy invited me to join the Straw Hats.
quotes.speaker: Jinbe

quotes.text: You take on too much responsibility, Jinbe. We should be able to defend ourselves. I will seek to borrow the Straw Hats' flag for protection.
quotes.speaker: Neptune
quotes.context: Proposing to switch protection from Big Mom to the Straw Hats

quotes.text: When Big Mom opens that box and it explodes, it will look like a declaration of war from Luffy!
quotes.speaker: Neptune
quotes.context: Worrying about the consequences of the booby-trapped treasure

themes.description: The episode explores the unintended consequences of actions, particularly how the booby-trapped Tamate Box meant to protect Fish-Man Island's treasure could trigger a war with an Emperor.
themes.symbolism: The Tamate Box represents how past decisions (rigging it with bombs) can have unforeseen future consequences.

themes.theme: Power Hierarchy in the New World
themes.description: The episode demonstrates the vast power difference between Paradise and New World level threats, showing how Haki users dominate Logia Devil Fruit users.
themes.symbolism: Pekoms' easy defeat of Caribou symbolizes the New World standard where Haki is essential for survival.

themes.description: The shifting protection of Fish-Man Island from Big Mom to the Straw Hats represents changing power dynamics and Luffy's growing influence in the pirate world.
themes.symbolism: The pirate flag serves as a symbol of protection and territorial claim in the One Piece world.

characterSpotlights.development: Pekoms showcases his combat abilities and Devil Fruit powers, establishing himself as a formidable member of Big Mom's crew.
keyActions: Transforms into turtle form to block Caribou's attack
Retrieves the Tamate Box treasure for Big Mom
quotes: My shell is hard as diamond!
The downfall of a Logia is its own pride of invincibility.

characterSpotlights.development: Jinbe makes the difficult choice to leave Big Mom's protection to join the Straw Hats, showing his commitment to Luffy despite the risks.
keyActions: Discusses leaving Big Mom with Neptune
Expresses concern about Fish-Man Island's safety
Agrees with Neptune's plan to use Straw Hat flag for protection
quotes: I'm thinking of cutting ties with Big Mom. Luffy invited me to join the Straw Hats.

characterSpotlights.development: Neptune shows growth as a leader by deciding Fish-Man Island can defend itself and choosing the Straw Hats over Big Mom for protection.
keyActions: Reassures Jinbe about the island's safety
Proposes using Straw Hat flag for protection
quotes: You take on too much responsibility, Jinbe. We should be able to defend ourselves.

characterSpotlights.development: Caribou's overconfidence in his Logia powers leads to his swift defeat, demonstrating he's unprepared for the New World.
keyActions: Gets defeated by a single Haki punch

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded scenes of the palace repairs and character reactions beyond what was shown in the manga.
Additional scenes of Smoker and the G-5 Marines were extended in the anime for pacing.

trivia.fact: Episode 572 adapts Chapter 652 (pages 2-17) of the manga, titled 'Start at a New Marineford!'
This episode marks the first appearance of the Kame Kame no Mi Devil Fruit powers, though the fruit's name isn't revealed until Episode 776 during the Zou Arc.

sources.title: Kame Kame no Mi - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Pekoms is the first and only confirmed mink character to have eaten a Devil Fruit in the series.

sources.title: Who is Pekoms in One Piece?

trivia.fact: The Tamate Box bomb setup in this episode pays off over 260 episodes later in Episode 834-835 during the Whole Cake Island arc.
This episode aired on November 11, 2012 in Japan with a TV rating of 9.6%, ranking 5th for that week.
Baron Tamago first appeared in Episode 570, not Episode 572, but continues to play a role in this episode.
